value.title: StarCraft 2: GAME OF THE YEAR! (So Far)
value.excerpt: Goblin versus Krystianer in an epic game of professional StarCraft 2. It's a bit early to call it the best game of SC2 of this year already, but it surely is the best so far. In this Protoss versus Protoss neither player ever manages to secure a solid economy so an intense micro battle is the only option.
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/N11AGSL2mE0" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: StarCraft 2: PROFESSIONAL 2v2?! (Maru & sOs vs MaxPax & souL)
value.excerpt: The standard competitive mode in StarCraft 2 is 1v1. However the OlimoLeague recently put on an event where they invited three teams of progamers to face off in a 2v2 (2 vs 2) event. In this video I cast a best-of-5 between Maru and sOs on one team, and MaxPax and souL on the other.  OlimoLeague on Patreon:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/qk3OKS90ckA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: StarCraft 2: Serral CHEESES MaxPax?! (Best-of-5)
value.excerpt: Best-of-5 series of professional StarCraft 2 between MaxPax (Protoss) and Serral (Zerg). A variety of games in this series, with a heavy macro focus and some cheese. value.title: StarCraft 2: The Honorable MACRO PROTOSS! (Reynor vs ShoWTimE)
value.excerpt: Best-of-5 series of top level European StarCraft 2 between Reynor (Zerg) and ShoWTimE (Protoss). The new patch has made Zerg versus Protoss a far more interesting matchup. Reynor has always been mid-game focused, but how does ShoWTimE deal with the change in the meta?  ShoWTimE on Twitter: https://twitter.com/showtimesc2

value.title: StarCraft 2: EPIC GAME - Super Long Action-Packed Pro Match! (Elazer vs Nice)
value.excerpt: One of the longest games of professional StarCraft 2 that I've seen. In this match of Zerg versus Protoss between Elazer and Nice we have a very active match all things considered. Most long games of pro SC2 are two players sitting back, but that is not the case between these two progamers at all.  World
